items.sentence: It\'s been three months since I moved to Boston.
There\'s a fountain in the middle of the garden.
That doesn\'t really seem appropriate right now.
That doesn\'t sound like something Tom would do.
Aren\'t you doing anything special this evening?
Aren\'t you going to go swimming this afternoon?
Tom always walks to school if it isn\'t raining.
This week has been terribly busy for both of us.
Three people died in a fire in Boston on Monday.
Have you already decided what to do next Monday?
How many Christmas carols can you sing by heart?
I need to tell Tom that Mary is in the hospital.
Tom believes that the stars control our futures.
Tom and his brothers grew up in the Boston area.
Tom and his cousins went into business together.
Tom has never been to a French-speaking country.
Tom had never realized just how lovely Mary was.
That isn\'t a risk that I\'d be willing to take.
Tom asked Mary when she was planning to go home.
Tom asked me if I knew anybody living in Boston.
Tom gave me three reasons why he couldn\'t help.
Why don\'t you stay and drink some wine with us?
Tom wasn\'t surprised who showed up to meet him.
It\'s unlikely Tom understands what\'s going on.
What was the name of that tune you were playing?
What would you do if Tom ever learned the truth?
Tom certainly made no attempt to stop the fight.
I think Tom is too old to be dating my daughter.
I don\'t know if it was Tom who did that or not.
Mary is probably going to tell Tom she\'s tired.
I want Tom to forgive Mary for what she\'s done.
Tom wasn\'t the only one who wasn\'t helping us.
Tom didn\'t plan on running into anyone he knew.
Tom didn\'t realize he had to help Mary do that.
Tom didn\'t really feel like eating Korean food.
Tom didn\'t see any familiar faces at the party.
Tom doesn\'t know Mary has spent time in prison.
Tom seems to be waiting for something to happen.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom will marry Mary.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom would ever move.
Tom should\'ve paid attention to what Mary said.
I ate an early lunch, so I\'m pretty hungry now.
I don\'t think Tom really planned on doing that.
I don\'t think Tom wants to go swimming with me.
I don\'t think Tom was listening very carefully.
I don\'t think anyone has ever done this before.
Tom sent Mary a dozen roses on Valentine\'s Day.
Tom poured wine into three long-stemmed glasses.
Tom said Mary wasn\'t planning to do that alone.
You\'ll remember this for the rest of your life.
